Enumerated.name: Iec61850.DpStatusKind
Enumerated.documentation: Double point status kind.

Unsigned.name: badState
Unsigned.documentation: The server can not detect whether the position is open (off), closed (on) or in intermediate state.

Sequence.name: Iec61850.EnumDA
Sequence.documentation: Not explicitly defined in the standard. Enumerated data attribute has only a value field of some enumerated type.

Sequence.name: Iec61850.ObjectReference
Sequence.documentation: part 7-2, sec. 5 Instances of classes in the hierarchical information model (ACSI class hierarchy of logical device, logical node, data, data attributes) shall be constructed by the concatenation of all instance names comprising the whole path-name of an instance of a class that identifies the instance uniquely. The ObjectReference syntax shall be: LDName/LNName[.Name[. ...]]. The "/" shall separate the instance name of a logical device (LDName) from the name of an instance of a logical node (LNName). The "." shall separate the further names in the hierarchy. The "[ ]" shall indicate an option. The inner square bracket "[. ...]" shall indicate further names of nested definitions. NOTE: Section 19 specifies constraints on the use of the type ObjectReference. Modelling notes: • We define this type as abstract class and extend it with the subtypes which carry semantics of the above naming scheme. • Subtypes of ObjectReference provide methods that return separately all the elements that make the reference (e.g., FC, LDName, LNName), which have been parsed from the reference string.

Sequence.name: Iec61850.CMV
Sequence.documentation: This common data class is used to represent complex (phasor) measured values.

Sequence.name: instCVal
Sequence.documentation: Instantaneous complex (phasor) value, with magnitude and angle.

Sequence.name: cVal
Sequence.documentation: Deadbanded complex value, based on a deadband calculation from the instantaneous value 'instCVal.mag' with 'db' and 'instCVal.ang' with 'dbAng', independently. See 'MV.mag'.

Enumerated.name: rangeAng
Enumerated.documentation: Range in which the current instantaneous value is ('MV.instMag' or 'CMV.instCVal.mag'). It may be used to report an event if its value changes (due to the change in the instantaneous value). See RangeConfig. NOTE The use of algorithms to filter events based on transition from one range to another is a local issue.

Sequence.name: q
Sequence.documentation: Quality of the data values 'instCVal', 'cVal', 'range'.

DateTime.name: t
DateTime.documentation: Timestamp of the last change in one of the data values 'cVal', 'range', or quality 'q'.

Sequence.name: subCVal
Sequence.documentation: Value used to substitute 'instCVal'.

Sequence.name: units
Sequence.documentation: Unit for 'instCVal.mag', 'cVal.mag', 'subCVal.mag', 'rangeC'.

Integer.name: dbAng
Integer.documentation: Deadband is a configuration parameter used to calculate deadbanded angle of a complex value ('cVal.ang'). The value of 'dbAng' shall represent the percentage of difference ('rangeAngC.max' - 'rangeAngC.min') in units of 0.001%. See 'RangeDeadbandCDC.db'.

Sequence.name: rangeAngC
Sequence.documentation: Configuration for 'rangeAng'.

Sequence.name: magSVC
Sequence.documentation: Configuration for scaled value representation of magnitudes 'instCVal.mag', 'cVal.mag', 'subCVal.mag'.

Sequence.name: angSVC
Sequence.documentation: Configuration for scaled value representation of angles 'instCVal.ang', 'cVal.ang', 'rangeAngC.min' and 'rangeAngC.max'.

Enumerated.name: angRef
Enumerated.documentation: Angle reference, indicating the quantity that is used as reference for the phase angles 'cVal.ang', 'instCVal.ang', subCVal.ang'. For the indicated quantity, the fundamental frequency (index = 1) is used as reference by convention.

Integer.name: smpRate
Integer.documentation: Number of samples per nominal period that has been used to determine instantaneous value 'instCVal.mag'.In the case of a dc system, it is number of samples per s.

Sequence.name: Iec61850.DEL
Sequence.documentation: This class is a collection of measurements of values in a three phase system that represent phase to phase values ("delta"). Values for 'phsAB', 'phsBC' and 'phsCA' have been simultaneously acquired or determined, and their respective time stamps hold the same value 't.secondSinceEpoch'. It shall be assumed that any jitter between the acquisition times dedicated for these values is neglectable. The jitter for simultaneity shall be as indicated in any of the respective 't.timeQuality' attributes of the above values. Attribute 'angRef' is used in place of individual 'angRef' attributes of 'phsAB', 'phsBC' and 'phsCA'.

Sequence.name: phsAB
Sequence.documentation: Value of phase A to phase B measurement.

Sequence.name: phsBC
Sequence.documentation: Value of phase B to phase C measurement.

Sequence.name: phsCA
Sequence.documentation: Value of phase C to phase A measurement.

Enumerated.name: angRef
Enumerated.documentation: Angle reference, indicating the quantity that is used as reference for the phase angles {'phsAB', 'phsBC', 'phsCA'}.'instCVal.ang', instead of their own 'angRef'. For the indicated quantity, the fundamental frequency (index = 1) is used as reference by convention.

Sequence.name: Iec61850.HarmonicMeasurandCDC
Sequence.documentation: This abstract supertype groups the configuration attributes for common data classes that provide harmonic and interharmonic measurand information. Attributes are used to configure arrays of harmonic values in concrete CDCs ('har[] in HMV, {'phsAHar', 'phsBHar', phsCHar', 'neutHar', 'netHar', 'resHar'}[] in HWYE, and {'phsABHar', phsBCHar', 'phsCAHar'}[] in HDEL). An array (e.g., 'har[]') contains the harmonic and subharmonic ('evalTm' equals 'frequency' period), or the interharmonic values ('evalTm' differs from 'frequency' period). The first array element 'har[0]' contains the dc component, the further array elements 'har[1]'...'har['numHar']' contain the values for the harmonics 1..'numHar', respectively. For the case of harmonic and subharmonic values ('evalTm' equals'frequency' period), if 'numCyc'>1, 'har[]' contains both harmonics, and subharmonics with their multiples. Array elements with the index that is a multiple of 2'numCyc'-1 are harmonics; all the others are subharmonics or multiple of subharmonics.

Integer.name: numHar
Integer.documentation: Number of harmonic and subharmonics, or interharmonic values that are to be returned as the array of values. Array index 0 refers to the dc component, therefore 'numHar'>0. The maximum value can be calculated as follows: 'numHar' = 1 + 0.5 * ('smpRate' * 'frequency' * 'evalTm' * 2'numCyc'-1).

Integer.name: numCyc
Integer.documentation: Number of cycles of power frequency, which are used for harmonic, subharmonic and interharmonic calculation. See 'numHar'.

Integer.name: evalTm
Integer.documentation: Time window [ms] applied to interharmonic calculations. See 'numHar'.

Integer.name: smpRate
Integer.documentation: Determines the highest possible harmonic or interharmonic detectable, according to the sampling theorem; the minimum value is 'smpRate'=2 * 'frequency'. 'smpRate' is the number of samples per nominal period. In the case of a dc system, it is number of samples per s.

Real.name: frequency
Real.documentation: Nominal frequency of the power system (HMV, HDEL) or some other fundamental frequency (HWYE) [Hz].

Enumerated.name: hvRef
Enumerated.documentation: Reference type (i.e., ratio of harmonic to fundamental, to RMS or to absolute), of the values in 'CMV[i].instCVal.mag'.

Integer.name: rmsCyc
Integer.documentation: Number of cycles of power frequency used for the calculation of rms values.

Sequence.name: Iec61850.HMV
Sequence.documentation: This class is a collection of values that represent the harmonic or interharmonic content of a process value. NOTE Harmonics for a single circuit may have phase angles, but need no reference for the angle ('angRef'), since by convention the reference is always the fundamental frequency (index 1).

Array.name: har
Array.documentation: Array of harmonic and subharmonic, or the interharmonic values.

Sequence.name: Iec61850.MV
Sequence.documentation: This common data class is used to represent scalar measured values.

Sequence.name: instMag
Sequence.documentation: Magnitude of the instantaneous value. NOTE 'instMag' is optional from the perspective of the visibility of that value to the communication. The instantaneous value may be required for the internal behaviour of the function, e.g., to perform the deadband calculation for 'mag'.

Sequence.name: mag
Sequence.documentation: Magnitude based on a deadband 'db' calculation from the instantaneous value 'instMag'. The value of 'mag' shall be updated to the current instantaneous value 'instMag' when the value has changed according the configured deadband 'db'. If 'db'=0, 'mag'='instMag'. NOTE 1 This value is typically used to create reports for analogue values. Such a report sent "by exception" is not comparable to the transfer of sampled measured values as supported by the CDC SAV. NOTE 2 This 'mag' is not the same as 'Vector.mag'. In particular, the value 'CMV.instCVal.mag' is NOT a deadbanded value.

Sequence.name: q
Sequence.documentation: Quality of the data values 'instMag', 'mag', 'range'.

DateTime.name: t
DateTime.documentation: Timestamp of the last change in one of the data values 'mag', 'range', or quality 'q'.

Sequence.name: subMag
Sequence.documentation: Value used to substitute 'instMag'.

Sequence.name: units
Sequence.documentation: Unit for 'instMag', 'mag', 'subMag', 'rangeC'.

Sequence.name: sVC
Sequence.documentation: Configuration for scaled value representation ('instMag', 'mag', 'subMag', 'range').

Integer.name: smpRate
Integer.documentation: Number of samples per nominal period that has been used to determine instantaneous value 'instMag'. In the case of a dc system, it is number of samples per s.

Sequence.name: Iec61850.RangeDeadbandCDC
Sequence.documentation: This abstract supertype groups the attributes common to those common data classes that provide deadbanded values (in addition to instantaneous ones).

Enumerated.name: range
Enumerated.documentation: Range in which the current instantaneous value is ('MV.instMag' or 'CMV.instCVal.mag'). It may be used to report an event if its value changes (due to the change in the instantaneous value). See RangeConfig. NOTE The use of algorithms to filter events based on transition from one range to another is a local issue.

Integer.name: db
Integer.documentation: Deadband is a configuration parameter used to calculate deadbanded value ('MV.mag' or 'CMV.cVal.mag'). The value of 'db' shall represent the percentage of difference ('rangeC.max' - 'rangeC.min') in units of 0.001%. Therefore, 'db'=[0, 100'000], corresponding to [0%, 100%], respectively. If an integral calculation is used to determine the deadbanded value, the value of 'db' shall be represented as 0,001% s. Value 0 shall suppress reporting events on the analog value, so that only changes of the 'range' value will lead to events.

Integer.name: zeroDb
Integer.documentation: Configuration parameter used to calculate the range around zero, where the deadbanded value ('MV.mag' or CMV.cVal.mag') will be forced to zero. The value of 'zeroDb' shall represent the percentage of difference ('rangeC.max' - 'rangeC.min') in units of 0,001%. Therefore, 'zeroDb'=[0, 100'000], corresponding to [0%, 100%], respectively.

Sequence.name: rangeC
Sequence.documentation: Configuration for 'range'.

Sequence.name: Iec61850.WYE
Sequence.documentation: This class is a collection of simultaneous measurements of values in a three phase system that represent phase to ground values ("wye"). Values for 'phsA', 'phsB', 'phsC', 'neut', 'net' and 'res' have been simultaneously acquired or determined, and their respective time stamps hold the same value 't.secondSinceEpoch'. It shall be assumed that any jitter between the acquisition times dedicated for these values is neglectable. The jitter for simultaneity shall be as indicated in any of the respective 't.timeQuality' attributes of the above values. Attribute 'angRef' is used in place of individual 'angRef' attributes of 'phsA', 'phsB', 'phsC', 'neut', 'net' and 'res'.

Sequence.name: phsA
Sequence.documentation: Value of phase A.

Sequence.name: phsB
Sequence.documentation: Value of phase B.

Sequence.name: phsC
Sequence.documentation: Value of phase C.

Sequence.name: neut
Sequence.documentation: Value of the measured phase neutral. If a direct measurement of this value is not available, it is acceptable to substitute an estimate computed by creating the algebraic sum of the instantaneous values of currents flowing through all live conductors ('phsA.instCVal'+'phsB.instCVal'+'phsC.instCVal'); in that case, 'neut'='res'.

Sequence.name: net
Sequence.documentation: Net current, as the algebraic sum of the instantaneous values of currents flowing through all live conductors and neutral point of the electrical installation('phsA.instCVal'+'phsB.instCVal'+'phsC.instCVal'+'neut.instCVal').

Sequence.name: res
Sequence.documentation: Residual current, as the algebraic sum of the instantaneous values of currents flowing through all live conductors of the electrical installation('phsA.instCVal'+'phsB.instCVal'+'phsC.instCVal').

Enumerated.name: angRef
Enumerated.documentation: Angle reference, indicating the quantity that is used as reference for the phase angles {'phsA', 'phsB', 'phsC', 'neut', 'net', 'res'}.'instCVal.ang', instead of their own 'angRef'. For the indicated quantity, the fundamental frequency (index = 1) is used as reference by convention.

Boolean.name: phsToNeut
Boolean.documentation: True indicates that this WYE instance is used for phase to neutral values instead of phase to ground values ('neut' always indicates the neutral to ground value).

Sequence.name: Iec61850.ASG
Sequence.documentation: This common data class is used to represent analogue settings.

Sequence.name: setMag
Sequence.documentation: The value of the analogue setting.

Sequence.name: units
Sequence.documentation: Unit for 'setMag', 'minVal', 'maxVal', 'stepSize'.

Sequence.name: sVC
Sequence.documentation: Configuration for scaled value representation ('setMag', 'minVal', 'maxVal', 'stepSize').

Sequence.name: minVal
Sequence.documentation: Minimum setting for 'setMag'.

Sequence.name: maxVal
Sequence.documentation: Maximum setting for 'setMag'.

Sequence.name: stepSize
Sequence.documentation: Step between the individual values of 'setMag'.

Sequence.name: Iec61850.CSG
Sequence.documentation: This common data class is used to hold curve points and describe curve settings.

Real.name: pointZ
Real.documentation: Position of the curve on z-axis.

Integer.name: numPts
Integer.documentation: Actual size of 'crvPts[]'.

Array.name: crvPts
Array.documentation: The array with the points specifying a curve shape.

Sequence.name: xUnit
Sequence.documentation: Unit of the x-axis of a curve.

Sequence.name: yUnit
Sequence.documentation: Unit of the y-axis of a curve.

Sequence.name: zUnit
Sequence.documentation: Unit of the z-axis of a curve.

Integer.name: maxPts
Integer.documentation: Maximum supported size for 'crvPts[]'.

String.name: xD
String.documentation: Description of the value of the x-axis of a curve.

String.name: xDU
String.documentation: Description of the value of the x-axis of a curve in Unicode.

String.name: yD
String.documentation: Description of the value of the y-axis of a curve.

String.name: yDU
String.documentation: Description of the value of the x-axis of a curve in Unicode.

String.name: zD
String.documentation: Description of the value of the z-axis of a curve.

String.name: zDU
String.documentation: Description of the value of the z-axis of a curve in Unicode.

Sequence.name: Iec61850.APC
Sequence.documentation: This common data class is used to represent analogue controls.

Sequence.name: origin
Sequence.documentation: See 'SPC.origin'.

Integer.name: ctlNum
Integer.documentation: See 'SPC.ctlNum'.

Sequence.name: mxVal
Sequence.documentation: Current value of the controllable analogue process value; it can be deadbanded for reporting.

Sequence.name: q
Sequence.documentation: Quality of the data value 'mxVal'.

DateTime.name: t
DateTime.documentation: Timestamp of the last change in the data value 'mxVal', or quality 'q'.

Boolean.name: stSeld
Boolean.documentation: See 'SPC.stSeld'.

Sequence.name: subVal
Sequence.documentation: Value used to substitute 'mxVal'.

Sequence.name: units
Sequence.documentation: Units of the data values: 'mxVal', 'subVal', 'minVal', 'maxVal', 'stepSize', 'ctlVal'.

Integer.name: db
Integer.documentation: See 'RangeDeadbandCDC.db'. Used in case 'mxVal' is deadbanded for reporting.

Sequence.name: sVC
Sequence.documentation: Configuration for scaled value representation ('mxVal', 'subVal', 'minVal', 'maxVal', 'stepSize') and for service parameter 'ctlVal'.

Sequence.name: minVal
Sequence.documentation: Minimum setting for 'ctlVal'.

Sequence.name: maxVal
Sequence.documentation: Maximum setting for 'ctlVal'.

Sequence.name: stepSize
Sequence.documentation: Step between the individual values of 'ctlVal'.

Sequence.name: ctlVal
Sequence.documentation: Service parameter that determines the control activity, containing the new value for 'mxVal'.

Sequence.name: Iec61850.DPC
Sequence.documentation: This common data class is used to represent double point controls.

Sequence.name: origin
Sequence.documentation: See 'SPC.origin'.

Integer.name: ctlNum
Integer.documentation: See 'SPC.ctlNum'.

Enumerated.name: stVal
Enumerated.documentation: Status data value.

Sequence.name: q
Sequence.documentation: Quality of the data value 'stVal'.

DateTime.name: t
DateTime.documentation: Timestamp of the last change of the data value 'stVal' or quality 'q'.

Boolean.name: stSeld
Boolean.documentation: See 'SPC.stSeld'.

Enumerated.name: subVal
Enumerated.documentation: Value used to substitute 'stVal'.

Sequence.name: pulseConfig
Sequence.documentation: See 'SPC.pulseConfig'.

Boolean.name: ctlVal
Boolean.documentation: Service parameter that determines the control activity, containing the new value for 'stVal' ('false' for off, 'true' for on).

Sequence.name: Iec61850.ENC
Sequence.documentation: This common data class is used to represent integer controls with the value restricted to those in an enumeration.

Sequence.name: origin
Sequence.documentation: See 'SPC.origin'.

Integer.name: ctlNum
Integer.documentation: See 'SPC.ctlNum'.

Sequence.name: stVal
Sequence.documentation: Status data value.

Sequence.name: q
Sequence.documentation: Quality of the data value 'stVal'.

DateTime.name: t
DateTime.documentation: Timestamp of the last change of the data value 'stVal' or quality 'q'.

Boolean.name: stSeld
Boolean.documentation: See 'SPC.stSeld'.

Sequence.name: subVal
Sequence.documentation: Value used to substitute 'stVal'.

Sequence.name: ctlVal
Sequence.documentation: Service parameter that determines the control activity, containing the new value for 'stVal'.

Sequence.name: Iec61850.SPC
Sequence.documentation: This common data class is used to represent single point controls.

Sequence.name: origin
Sequence.documentation: Information related to the originator of the last change of the controllable data value.

Integer.name: ctlNum
Integer.documentation: Control sequence number of the control service when the change of the status data value has been caused by a control. The only thing that the server shall do with 'ctlNum' is to include it in the responses to the control model and in the reports about a status change that is caused by a command.

Boolean.name: stVal
Boolean.documentation: Status data value.

Sequence.name: q
Sequence.documentation: Quality of the data value 'stVal'.

DateTime.name: t
DateTime.documentation: Timestamp of the last change of the data value 'stVal' or quality 'q'.

Boolean.name: stSeld
Boolean.documentation: True means that the controllable data is in the status "selected".

Boolean.name: subVal
Boolean.documentation: Value used to substitute 'stVal'.

Sequence.name: pulseConfig
Sequence.documentation: Used to configure the output pulse generated with the command, if applicable.

Boolean.name: ctlVal
Boolean.documentation: Service parameter that determines the control activity, containing the new value for 'stVal' ('false' for off, 'true' for on).

Sequence.name: Iec61850.DPL
Sequence.documentation: This common data class is used to identify entities like primary equipment or physical devices.

String.name: location
String.documentation: Location where the equipment is installed.

String.name: name
String.documentation: The name of the IED (if DPL is used in the context of a LPHD) or of a device like a circuit breaker (if used for the data EEName).

String.name: ePSName
String.documentation: Name of electric power system the device is connected to.

Real.name: latitude
Real.documentation: Geographical position of device in WGS84 coordinates – latitude.

Real.name: longitude
Real.documentation: Geographical position of device in WGS84 coordinates – longitude.

Real.name: altitude
Real.documentation: Geographical position of device in WGS84 coordinates – altitude.

String.name: mrID
String.documentation: Master resource ID – unique identification of an asset or device.

Sequence.name: Iec61850.LPL
Sequence.documentation: This common data class is used for nameplate information of logical nodes.

String.name: configRev
String.documentation: Uniquely identifies the configuration of a logical device instance. 'LLN0.NamPlt.configRev' has to be changed at least on any semantic change of the data model of the logical device, related to the client functionality. How this is detected and performed is left to the user. Also the semantics of 'configRev' for other logical nodes is left to the user. For further details see as well Annex C.

Integer.name: paramRev
Integer.documentation: Uniquely identifies the parameter revision of a logical device or logical node instance. 'paramRev' has to be changed at least on any change of a parameter (FC= SE or FC=SP) within this logical device or logical node. How this is detected and performed is left to the user. For further details see as well Annex C. The value change of 'paramRev' shall be done as follows: • if the parameter change is done in the IED only through communication services or through the local HMI, this value shall be increased by one; • if the parameter change is done in the configuration file, this value shall be increased by 10 000.

Integer.name: valRev
Integer.documentation: Uniquely identifies the revision of the preconfiguration of configuration values (FC= CF) in a logical device or logical node instance through a SCL file. 'valRev' has to be changed at least on any change of preconfigured values within an SCL file for this logical device or logical node. How this is detected and performed is left to the user. For further details see as well Annex C. The value change of 'valRev' shall be done according to the same rules as for 'paramRev'.

String.name: ldNs
String.documentation: Logical device name space. Scope of the standard specified with the attribute is LN class definition (CDC definition by reference). For details see IEC 61850-7-1.

String.name: lnNs
String.documentation: Logical node name space. Scope of the standard specified with the attribute is LN class definition (CDC definition by reference). For details see IEC 61850-7-1.

Sequence.name: Iec61850.BCR
Sequence.documentation: This common data class is used to represent binary counter reading.

Integer.name: actVal
Integer.documentation: Binary counter status represented as an integer value.

Integer.name: frVal
Integer.documentation: Frozen binary counter status represented as an integer value.

DateTime.name: frTm
DateTime.documentation: Time of the last counter freeze.

Sequence.name: q
Sequence.documentation: Quality of the data values 'actVal', 'frVal'.

DateTime.name: t
DateTime.documentation: Timestamp of the last change of the data value 'actVal' or quality 'q'.

Sequence.name: units
Sequence.documentation: Unit for value calculated as [value = 'actVal * pulsQty'], [value = 'frVal * pulsQty'].

Real.name: pulsQty
Real.documentation: Magnitude of the counted value per count. Used together with 'actVal' and 'frVal' to calculate the value: [value = 'actVal * pulsQty'], [value = 'frVal * pulsQty'].

Boolean.name: frEna
Boolean.documentation: Controls the freeze process. If true, freezing shall occur as specified in 'strTm', 'frPd' and 'frRs'; otherwise, no freezing shall occur.

DateTime.name: strTm
DateTime.documentation: Starting time of the freeze process. If the current time is later than 'strTm', the first freeze shall occur at the expiration of the next freeze interval 'frPd', computed from 'strTm' setting.

Integer.name: frPd
Integer.documentation: Time interval between freeze operations [ms]. If value is 0, only a single freeze is performed at the time indicated in 'strTm'.

Boolean.name: frRs
Boolean.documentation: If true, the counter is to be automatically reset to zero after each freezing process.

Sequence.name: Iec61850.ENS
Sequence.documentation: This common data class is used to represent integer status values with the value restricted to those in an enumeration.

Sequence.name: stVal
Sequence.documentation: Status data value.

Sequence.name: q
Sequence.documentation: Quality of the data value 'stVal'.

DateTime.name: t
DateTime.documentation: Timestamp of the last change of the data value 'stVal' or quality 'q'.

Sequence.name: subVal
Sequence.documentation: Value used to substitute 'stVal'.

Sequence.name: Iec61850.INS
Sequence.documentation: This common data class is used to represent integer status values.

Integer.name: stVal
Integer.documentation: Status data value.

Sequence.name: q
Sequence.documentation: Quality of the data value 'stVal'.

DateTime.name: t
DateTime.documentation: Timestamp of the last change of the data value 'stVal' or quality 'q'.

Integer.name: subVal
Integer.documentation: Value used to substitute 'stVal'.

Sequence.name: units
Sequence.documentation: Unit for 'stVal', 'subVal'.

Sequence.name: Iec61850.SPS
Sequence.documentation: This common data class is used to represent single point status values.

Boolean.name: stVal
Boolean.documentation: Status data value.

Sequence.name: q
Sequence.documentation: Quality of the data value 'stVal'.

DateTime.name: t
DateTime.documentation: Timestamp of the last change of the data value 'stVal' or quality 'q'.

Boolean.name: subVal
Boolean.documentation: Value used to substitute 'stVal'.

Sequence.name: Iec61850.CUG
Sequence.documentation: This common data class is used to represent currency settings.

Enumerated.name: cur
Enumerated.documentation: The value of the currency setting.

Sequence.name: Iec61850.ENG
Sequence.documentation: This common data class is used to represent integer settings with the value restricted to those in an enumeration.

Sequence.name: setVal
Sequence.documentation: The value of the status setting.

Sequence.name: Iec61850.ING
Sequence.documentation: This common data class is used to represent integer settings.

Integer.name: setVal
Integer.documentation: The value of the status setting.

Integer.name: minVal
Integer.documentation: Minimum setting for 'setVal'.

Integer.name: maxVal
Integer.documentation: Maximum setting for 'setVal'.

Integer.name: stepSize
Integer.documentation: Step between the individual values of 'setVal'.

Sequence.name: units
Sequence.documentation: Unit for 'setVal', 'minVal', 'maxVal', 'stepSize'.

Sequence.name: Iec61850.ORG
Sequence.documentation: This common data class is used to represent object reference settings, such as object reference to the logical node of which the statistical data have been calculated.

Sequence.name: setSrcRef
Sequence.documentation: The value of the object reference setting used to reference for example a logical node instance or a data object instance.

Sequence.name: setTstRef
Sequence.documentation: The value of the test object reference setting, used as alternative to 'setSrcRef' when 'tstEna'=true for testing purpose.

Sequence.name: setSrcCB
Sequence.documentation: The value of the object reference to the control block, indicating from where the object referred to with 'setSrcRef' shall be received.

Sequence.name: setTstCB
Sequence.documentation: The value of the object reference to the control block indicating from where the object referred to with 'setTstRef' shall be received, used when 'tstEna'=true for testing purposes.

Boolean.name: tstEna
Boolean.documentation: Switch between original data source (as defined with 'setSrcRef' and 'setSrcCB') for a reference and test data source (as defined with 'setTstRef' and 'setTstCB').

String.name: purpose
String.documentation: Description of the purpose of the object reference.

Sequence.name: Iec61850.SPG
Sequence.documentation: This common data class is used to represent single point settings.

Boolean.name: setVal
Boolean.documentation: The value of the status setting (false is off, true is on).

Sequence.name: Iec61850.AnalogueValue
Sequence.documentation: This type is used to represent primary process measured value, pVal. An analogue value may be represented by applying an appropriate conversion to a basic type integer 'i' or to a floating point 'f'. At least one of the attributes shall be used. If both 'i' and 'f' exist, the application in the server shall insure that both values remain consistent, i.e., that the pVal produced after appropriate conversion is the same within acceptable error. The latest value set by the communication service shall be used to update the other value. As an example, if 'xxx.f' is written, the application shall update 'xxx.i' accordingly. NOTE The reason for both integer and floating point representation is so that IEDs without floating point capabilities are enabled to support analogue values. In this case, the scaleFactor and offset may be exchanged offline between clients and servers.

Integer.name: i
Integer.documentation: Integer representation of the measured value. The formula to convert between 'i' and the process value (pVal) shall be: pVal=('i'*'ScaledValueConfig.scaleFactor')+'ScaledValueConfig.offset'.

Real.name: f
Real.documentation: Floating point representation of the measured value. The formula to convert between 'f' and the process value (pVal) shall be: pVal='f'*10'Unit.multiplier'.

Sequence.name: Iec61850.DetailQual
Sequence.documentation: This type contains reason for an 'invalid' or 'questionable' value. See statechart diagram 'Quality.validity'.

Boolean.name: overflow
Boolean.documentation: If true, the value of the attribute to which the quality has been associated is beyond the capability of being represented properly (used for measurand information only). EXAMPLE A measured value may exceed the range that may be represented by the selected data type, for example the data type is a 16-bit unsigned integer and the value exceeds 65535.

Boolean.name: outOfRange
Boolean.documentation: If true, the attribute to which the quality has been associated is beyond a predefined range of values. The server shall decide if validity shall be set to invalid or questionable (used for measurand information only). EXAMPLE A measured value may exceed a predefined range, however the selected data type can still represent the value, for example the data type is a 16-bit unsigned integer, the predefined range is 0 to 40000, if the value is between 40001 and 65535 it is considered to be out of range.

Boolean.name: badReference
Boolean.documentation: If true, the value may not be a correct value due to a reference being out of calibration. The server shall decide if validity shall be set to invalid or questionable (used for measurand information and binary counter information only).

Boolean.name: oscillatory
Boolean.documentation: To prevent overloading of event driven communication channels, it is desirable to detect and suppress oscillating (fast changing) binary inputs. If a signal changes in a defined time (tosc) twice in the same direction (from 0 to 1 or from 1 to 0), then it shall be defined as an oscillation and this attribute shall be set to true. If a configured numbers of transient changes is detected, they shall be suppressed. In this time, the 'Quality.validity' shall be set to 'questionable'. If the signal is still in the oscillating state after the defined number of changes, the value shall be left in the state it was in when this flag was set. In this case, the 'Quality.validity' shall be changed from 'questionable' to 'invalid' and kept so as long as the signal is oscillating. If the configuration is such that all transient changes should be suppressed, the 'Quality.validity' shall be set immediately to 'invalid' and this flag to true (used for status information only).

Boolean.name: failure
Boolean.documentation: If true, a supervision function has detected an internal or external failure.

Boolean.name: oldData
Boolean.documentation: If true, an update is not made during a specific time interval. The value may be an old value that may have changed in the meantime. This specific time interval may be defined by an allowed-age attribute. NOTE "Fail silent" errors, where the equipment stops sending data, will cause setting this flag to true. In this case, the last received information was correct.

Boolean.name: inconsistent
Boolean.documentation: If true, an evaluation function has detected an inconsistency.

Boolean.name: inaccurate
Boolean.documentation: If true, the value does not meet the stated accuracy of the source. EXAMPLE The measured value of power factor may be noisy (inaccurate) when the current is very small.

Sequence.name: Iec61850.Originator
Sequence.documentation: This type is used to describe the originator of the last change of a controllable data.

Enumerated.name: orCat
Enumerated.documentation: Category indicates who/what caused the change of a controllable process value. If the initiator of a change is not known, this attribute shall be set to 'process'.

String.name: orIdent
String.documentation: Identification of the originator of the value change. If the initiator of a change is not known, this value shall be set to null.

Sequence.name: Iec61850.Point
Sequence.documentation: This type is used to represent points in a two or three dimensional coordinate system.

Sequence.name: Iec61850.PulseConfig
Sequence.documentation: As the result of receiving an 'operate' service request, a pulsed output may be generated to the on or off input of a switching device. This type is used to configure that output pulse. If 'cmdQual=pulse', the duration of the pulse shall be defined with 'onDur', 'offDur' and 'numPls'. If 'cmdQual=persistent', the output stays in the state indicated in the 'operate' service request.

Enumerated.name: cmdQual
Enumerated.documentation: Kind of control output.

Integer.name: onDur
Integer.documentation: Duration of the pulse [ms]. If set to 0, the duration is defined locally.

Integer.name: offDur
Integer.documentation: Duration between two pulses [ms]. If set to 0, the duration is defined locally.

Integer.name: numPls
Integer.documentation: Number of pulses that are generated.

Sequence.name: Iec61850.Quality
Sequence.documentation: Quality contains data that describe the quality of the data from the server. Quality of the data is also related to the mode of a logical node. Further details can be found in IEC 61850-7-4. The different quality attributes are not independent. The default value shall be applied if the functionality of the related attribute is not supported. The mapping may specify to exclude the attribute from the message if it is not supported or if the default value applies.

Enumerated.name: validity
Enumerated.documentation: Validity of the value, as condensed information for the client. In case this value is not 'good', the reasons may be found in the 'detailQual'. See statechart diagram 'Quality.validity'.

Sequence.name: detailQual
Sequence.documentation: Describes reason in case 'validity' is not 'good'. See statechart diagram 'Quality.validity'.

Enumerated.name: source
Enumerated.documentation: Defines the source of a value. NOTE 1 Substitution may be done locally or via the communication services. In the second case, specific attributes with a FC=SV are used. NOTE 2 There are various means to clear a substitution. As an example, a substitution that was done following an invalid condition may be cleared automatically if the invalid condition is cleared. However, this is a local issue and therefore not in the scope of this standard.

Boolean.name: test
Boolean.documentation: If true, the value is a test value and not to be used for operational purposes. The processing of the test quality in the client shall be as described in IEC 61850-7-4. This bit shall be completely independent from the other bits within the quality descriptor.

Boolean.name: operatorBlocked
Boolean.documentation: If true, further update of the value has been blocked by an operator. The value shall be the information that was acquired before blocking. If this flag is set, then the 'detailQul.oldData' shall also be set. The operator shall use the data attribute 'CDC.blkEna' to block the update of the value. NOTE Both an operator as well as an automatic function may freeze communication updating as well as input updating. In both cases, 'detailQual.oldData' will be set. If the blocking is done by an operator, then this flag is set additionally, and an operator activity is required to clear the condition. EXAMPLE An operator may freeze the update of an input, to save the old value before the auxiliary supply is switched off.

Sequence.name: Iec61850.RangeConfig
Sequence.documentation: This type is used to configure the limits that define the range of a measured value.

Sequence.name: hhLim
Sequence.documentation: Setting for 'CDC.range' transition between 'high' and 'high-high'.

Sequence.name: hLim
Sequence.documentation: Setting for 'CDC.range' transition between 'normal' and 'high'.

Sequence.name: lLim
Sequence.documentation: Setting for 'CDC.range' transition between 'normal' and 'low'.

Sequence.name: llLim
Sequence.documentation: Setting for 'CDC.range' transition between 'low' and 'low-low'.

Sequence.name: min
Sequence.documentation: The minimum process measurement for which 'AnalogueValue.[i,f]' is considered within process limits. If the value is lower, quality shall be set accordingly ('Quality.detailQual.outOfRange'=true => 'Quality.validity'='questionable'; see statechart diagram 'Quality.validity').

Sequence.name: max
Sequence.documentation: The maximum process measurement for which 'AnalogueValue.[i,f]' is considered within process limits. If the value is higher, quality shall be set accordingly ('Quality.detailQual.outOfRange'=true => 'Quality.validity'='questionable'; see statechart diagram 'Quality.validity').

Integer.name: limDb
Integer.documentation: When present, the value used to introduce a hysteresis in the calculation of 'range'. When a high/low limit has been crossed, 'range' is immediately set to the higher/lower value. However, 'range' is only set back to the lower/higher value when the value of the high limit minus/low limit plut 'limDb' has been crossed. The value shall represent the percentage between 'max' and 'min' in units of 0.001 %.

Sequence.name: Iec61850.ScaledValueConfig
Sequence.documentation: This type is used to configure the integer value representation of the analogue value. See AnalogueValue.i. NOTE If a server does not support transmission of floating point values and needs to apply conversion, the client may retrieve these values from the SCL file.

Real.name: scaleFactor
Real.documentation: Scaling factor for integer representation of analogue value.

Real.name: offset
Real.documentation: Offset for integer representation of analogue value.

Sequence.name: Iec61850.Unit
Sequence.documentation: This type is used to represent unit and multiplier information.

Enumerated.name: multiplier
Enumerated.documentation: Unit multiplier.

Enumerated.name: SIUnit
Enumerated.documentation: SI unit of measure.

Sequence.name: Iec61850.Vector
Sequence.documentation: This type is used to represent a complex value (phasor), with magnitude and angle.

Sequence.name: mag
Sequence.documentation: Magnitude of the complex value.

Sequence.name: ang
Sequence.documentation: Angle of the complex value [deg]; angle reference is defined in the context where this type is used.

Enumerated.name: Iec61850.SourceKind
Enumerated.documentation: Source of a value.

Unsigned.name: process
Unsigned.documentation: The value is provided by an input function from the process I/O or is calculated from some application function.

Unsigned.name: substituted
Unsigned.documentation: The value is provided by an operator input or by an automatic source.

Enumerated.name: Iec61850.ValidityKind
Enumerated.documentation: This type is used as validity of a value. See statechart diagram 'Quality.validity'.

Unsigned.name: good
Unsigned.documentation: Supervision function has detected no abnormal condition of either the acquisition function or the information source.

Unsigned.name: invalid
Unsigned.documentation: Supervision function has detected an abnormal condition of the acquisition function or the information source (missing or non-operating updating devices). The value shall not be defined under this condition. It shall be used to indicate to the client that the value may be incorrect and shall not be used. EXAMPLE If an input unit detects an oscillation of one input it will mark the related information as invalid.

Unsigned.name: questionable
Unsigned.documentation: Supervision function has detected any abnormal behaviour. However, the value could still be valid. It is client's responsibility to determine whether the values should be used.

Enumerated.name: Iec61850.AngleReferenceKind
Enumerated.documentation: An enumeration defining the quantity that is used as reference for the phase angles.

Unsigned.name: Va
Unsigned.documentation: Angle reference is V phase a.

Unsigned.name: Vb
Unsigned.documentation: Angle reference is V phase b.

Unsigned.name: Vc
Unsigned.documentation: Angle reference is V phase c.

Unsigned.name: Aa
Unsigned.documentation: Angle reference is Amps phase a.

Unsigned.name: Ab
Unsigned.documentation: Angle reference is Amps phase b.

Unsigned.name: Ac
Unsigned.documentation: Angle reference is Amps phase c.

Unsigned.name: Vab
Unsigned.documentation: Angle reference is Volts phase a-b.

Unsigned.name: Vbc
Unsigned.documentation: Angle reference is Volts phase b-c.

Unsigned.name: Vca
Unsigned.documentation: Angle reference is Volts phase c-a.

Unsigned.name: Synchrophasor
Unsigned.documentation: Reference of the angle is as defined in IEEE C37.118, clause 4.2.

Enumerated.name: Iec61850.ControlOutputKind
Enumerated.documentation: An enumeration defining the kind of control output provided.

Unsigned.name: pulse
Unsigned.documentation: Control output is a pulse output.

Unsigned.name: persistent
Unsigned.documentation: Control output is a persistent output.

Enumerated.name: Iec61850.CtlModelKind
Enumerated.documentation: An enumeration defining the kind of control mechanism provided.

Unsigned.name: status-only
Unsigned.documentation: The object is not controllable, only the services that apply to a status object are supported. The attribute 'ctlVal' does not exist.

Unsigned.name: direct-with-normal-security
Unsigned.documentation: Direct control with normal security according to IEC 61850-7-2.

Unsigned.name: sbo-with-normal-security
Unsigned.documentation: SBO (select before operate) control with normal security according to IEC 61850-7-2.

Unsigned.name: direct-with-enhanced-security
Unsigned.documentation: Direct control with enhanced security according to IEC 61850-7-2.

Unsigned.name: sbo-with-enhanced-security
Unsigned.documentation: SBO control with enhanced security according to IEC 61850-7-2.

Enumerated.name: Iec61850.HvReferenceKind
Enumerated.documentation: Reference for harmonic values.

Enumerated.name: Iec61850.OriginatorCategoryKind
Enumerated.documentation: An enumeration specifying the category of the originator that caused a change of a value.

Unsigned.name: bay-control
Unsigned.documentation: Control operation issued from an operator using a client located at bay level.

Unsigned.name: station-control
Unsigned.documentation: Control operation issued from an operator using a client located at station level.

Unsigned.name: remote-control
Unsigned.documentation: Control operation from a remote operator outside the substation (for example network control center).

Unsigned.name: automatic-bay
Unsigned.documentation: Control operation issued from an automatic function at bay level.

Unsigned.name: automatic-station
Unsigned.documentation: Control operation issued from an automatic function at station level.

Unsigned.name: automatic-remote
Unsigned.documentation: Control operation issued from an automatic function outside of the substation.

Unsigned.name: maintenance
Unsigned.documentation: Control operation issued from a maintenance/service tool.

Unsigned.name: process
Unsigned.documentation: Status change occurred without control action (for example external trip of a circuit breaker or failure inside the breaker).

Enumerated.name: Iec61850.RangeKind
Enumerated.documentation: An enumeration that indicates the relationship of a measured value against configured settings.

Unsigned.name: high-high
Unsigned.documentation: Range of value exceeds high-high limit.

Unsigned.name: low-low
Unsigned.documentation: Range of value is lower than low-low limit.

Enumerated.name: Iec61850.SIUnitKind
Enumerated.documentation: An enumeration of SI units, derived from ISO 1000.

Sequence.name: Iec61850.ENCBehaviourMode
Sequence.documentation: Possible values for 'stVal', 'ctlVal', 'subVal', 'minVal', 'maxVal' are restricted by enumeration. Used for: Mod.

Sequence.name: Iec61850.ENGCalcIntervalType
Sequence.documentation: Possible values for 'setVal', 'minVal', 'maxVal' are restricted by enumeration. Used for: ClcIntvTyp, ClcRfTyp.

Sequence.name: Iec61850.ENGCalcMethod
Sequence.documentation: Possible values for 'setVal', 'minVal', 'maxVal' are restricted by enumeration. Used for: ClcMth.

Sequence.name: Iec61850.ENGCalcMode
Sequence.documentation: Possible values for 'setVal', 'minVal', 'maxVal' are restricted by enumeration. Used for: ClcMod.

Sequence.name: Iec61850.ENGPfSign
Sequence.documentation: Possible values for 'setVal', 'minVal', 'maxVal' are restricted by enumeration. Used for: PFSign.

Sequence.name: Iec61850.ENGSTotalCalcMethod
Sequence.documentation: Possible values for 'setVal', 'minVal', 'maxVal' are restricted by enumeration. Used for: ClcTotVA.

Sequence.name: Iec61850.ENSAdjustment
Sequence.documentation: Possible values for 'stVal', 'subVal' are restricted by enumeration. Used for: AdjSt.

Sequence.name: Iec61850.ENSBehaviourMode
Sequence.documentation: Possible values for 'stVal', 'subVal' are restricted by enumeration. Used for: Beh, Mod.

Sequence.name: Iec61850.ENSHealth
Sequence.documentation: Possible values for 'stVal', 'subVal' are restricted by enumeration. Used for: EEHealth, Health, PhyHealth, MechHealth.

Sequence.name: Iec61850.SPCTransient
Sequence.documentation: An SPC whose 'stVal' is transient. Not explicitly defined in the standard. Transient Data - the status of data with this designation is momentary and must be logged or reported to provide evidence of their momentary state. The transient property of data only applies to boolean process data attributes (FC=ST) of that data. Transient data is identical to normal data, except that for the process state change from TRUE to FALSE no event is generated for reporting and for logging.

Sequence.name: Iec61850.SPSTransient
Sequence.documentation: An SPS whose 'stVal' is transient. Not explicitly defined in the standard. Transient Data - the status of data with this designation is momentary and must be logged or reported to provide evidence of their momentary state. The transient property of data only applies to boolean process data attributes (FC=ST) of that data. Transient data is identical to normal data, except that for the process state change from TRUE to FALSE no event may be generated for reporting and for logging.

Enumerated.name: Iec61850.AdjustmentKind
Enumerated.documentation: An enumeration of an adjustment status.

Enumerated.name: Iec61850.BehaviourModeKind
Enumerated.documentation: Switching between the modes (Mod.stVal) should only happen as a result of an operator command to the data object Mod. Mod and Beh are always accessible by the services. The communication services for the data object Mod do not care about the status of the Beh of the LN. Logical nodes should process receiving data according to their quality information: • processed as valid means that the application should react according to the quality and the behaviour of the LN. • processes as invalid means the application should react as if the quality of the data had been invalid. • processed as blocked means that the application should decide how to react, besides no process-related action based on the value is performed. • statements "processed" and "not processed" don’t belong to communication services and therefore no quality bit can be evaluated.

Unsigned.name: on
Unsigned.documentation: Normal enabled state. All communication services work and get updated values.
Output to the process (switchgear) via a non-IEC 61850 link (for example wire, typical for X...,Y... and GGIO LNs): yes
Output of FC ST, MX (issued independently from Beh): value and q are relevant
Response to normal command from client: a+ (pos. ack.)
Response to test command from client: a- (neg. ack.)
Incoming data with q='normal': processed as valid
Incoming data with q='operatorBlocked': processed as blocked
Incoming data with q='test': processed as valid
Incoming data with q='test'+'operatorBlocked': processed as invalid
Incoming data with q='invalid': processed as invalid
Non-IEC 61850 binary (relay, contact) inputs and analogue (instrument transformer) inputs: processed

Unsigned.name: on-blocked
Unsigned.documentation: Process is passively supervised. No output data (digital by relays or analogue setting) will be issued to the process. All communication services work and get updated values. Data objects will be transmitted with quality 'operatorBlocked'.
Output to the process (switchgear) via a non-IEC 61850 link (for example wire, typical for X...,Y... and GGIO LNs): no
Output of FC ST, MX (issued independently from Beh): value is relevant, q='operatorBlocked'
Response to normal command from client: a- (neg. ack.)
Response to test command from client: a- (neg. ack.)
Incoming data with q='normal': processed as valid
Incoming data with q='operatorBlocked': processed as blocked
Incoming data with q='test': processed as invalid
Incoming data with q='test'+'operatorBlocked': processed as invalid
Incoming data with q='invalid': processed as invalid
Non-IEC 61850 binary (relay, contact) inputs and analogue (instrument transformer) inputs: processed

Unsigned.name: test
Unsigned.documentation: Function is operated but results are indicated as test results. All communication services work and get updated values. Data objects will be transmitted with quality 'test'. Control commands with quality 'test' will be accepted only by LNs in 'test' or 'test/blocked mode. Processed as valid means that the application should react in the manner what is foreseen for 'test'.
Output to the process (switchgear) via a non-IEC 61850 link (for example wire, typical for X...,Y... and GGIO LNs): yes
Output of FC ST, MX (issued independently from Beh): value is relevant, q='test'
Response to normal command from client: a- (neg. ack.)
Response to test command from client: a+ (pos. ack.)
Incoming data with q='normal': processed as valid
Incoming data with q='operatorBlocked': processed as blocked
Incoming data with q='test': processed as valid
Incoming data with q='test'+'operatorBlocked': processed as blocked
Incoming data with q='invalid': processed as invalid
Non-IEC 61850 binary (relay, contact) inputs and analogue (instrument transformer) inputs: processed

Unsigned.name: test/blocked
Unsigned.documentation: Function is operated in test mode, but with no impact to the process. No output data (digital by relays or analogue setting) will be issued to the process. All communication services work and get updated values. Data objects will be transmitted with quality 'test'. Control commands with quality test will be accepted only by LNs in 'test' or 'test/blocked' mode.
Output to the process (switchgear) via a non-IEC 61850 link (for example wire, typical for X...,Y... and GGIO LNs): no
Output of FC ST, MX (issued independently from Beh): value is relevant, q='test'+'operatorBlocked'
Response to normal command from client: a- (neg. ack.)
Response to test command from client: a+ (pos. ack.)
Incoming data with q='normal': processed as valid
Incoming data with q='operatorBlocked': processed as blocked
Incoming data with q='test': processed as valid
Incoming data with q='test'+'operatorBlocked': processed as blocked
Incoming data with q='invalid': processed as invalid
Non-IEC 61850 binary (relay, contact) inputs and analogue (instrument transformer) inputs: processed

Unsigned.name: off
Unsigned.documentation: Function is inactive but shows its configutation capability. No process output is possible. No control command should be acknowledged (negative response). Only the data object Mod and Beh should be accessible by the services.
Output to the process (switchgear) via a non-IEC 61850 link (for example wire, typical for X...,Y... and GGIO LNs): no
Output of FC ST, MX (issued independently from Beh): value is irrelevant, q='invalid'
Response to normal command from client: a- (neg. ack.)
Response to test command from client: a- (neg. ack.)
Incoming data with q='normal': not processed
Incoming data with q='operatorBlocked': not processed
Incoming data with q='test': not processed
Incoming data with q='test'+'operatorBlocked': not processed
Incoming data with q='invalid': not processed
Non-IEC 61850 binary (relay, contact) inputs and analogue (instrument transformer) inputs: not processed

Enumerated.name: Iec61850.CalcIntervalTypeKind
Enumerated.documentation: An enumeration of a calculation interval frequencies.

Enumerated.name: Iec61850.CalcMethodKind
Enumerated.documentation: An enumeration of calculation methods.

Unsigned.name: UNSPECIFIED
Unsigned.documentation: Calculation of the analogue values is unspecified.

Unsigned.name: TRUE_RMS
Unsigned.documentation: All analogue values are true r.m.s. values.

Unsigned.name: PEAK_FUNDAMENTAL
Unsigned.documentation: All analogue values are peak fundamental values.

Unsigned.name: RMS_FUNDAMENTAL
Unsigned.documentation: All analogue values are r.m.s. fundamental values.

Unsigned.name: MIN
Unsigned.documentation: All analogue values are minimum values.

Unsigned.name: MAX
Unsigned.documentation: All analogue values are maximum values.

Unsigned.name: AVG
Unsigned.documentation: All analogue values are average values.

Unsigned.name: SDV
Unsigned.documentation: All analogue values are standard deviation values.

Unsigned.name: PREDICTION
Unsigned.documentation: All analogue values are long term changes over time.

Unsigned.name: RATE
Unsigned.documentation: All analogue values are actual changes over time calculated with the actual and previous value.

Enumerated.name: Iec61850.CalcModeKind
Enumerated.documentation: An enumeration of calculation modes.

Unsigned.name: TOTAL
Unsigned.documentation: Total time from the first start of the device/application until the current time.

Unsigned.name: SLIDING
Unsigned.documentation: Sliding window from now predefined window backwards.

Enumerated.name: Iec61850.HealthKind
Enumerated.documentation: An enumeration of health status.

Unsigned.name: Warning
Unsigned.documentation: Minor problems, but in safe operating mode ("yellow"). The exact meaning is a local issue, depending on the dedicated function/device.

Enumerated.name: Iec61850.PfSignKind
Enumerated.documentation: An enumeration of power factor sign kind.

Sequence.name: Iec61850.DERComplexOutputRamping
Sequence.documentation: This logical node models a generic ramp. It is required due to the fact that the data object attributes of the ASG common data class do not contain all of the information required to achieve a full ramping function with divergent up and down trends (61850 LogicalNode FRMP).

Sequence.name: AdjSt
Sequence.documentation: 'AdjSt.stVal' is the state of adjustment process.

Sequence.name: Out
Sequence.documentation: 'Out.mag.f' is the analogue output of this function.

Sequence.name: ErrTerm
Sequence.documentation: 'ErrTerm.mag.f' is the control loop termination error value, in case the function cannot be fulfilled because of external reasons. The value is a difference between set point and actual value.

Sequence.name: RmpUp
Sequence.documentation: 'RmpUp.setMag.f' is the ramping rate on an upward trend.

Sequence.name: RmpDn
Sequence.documentation: 'RmpDn.setMag.f' is the ramping rate on a downward trend.

Sequence.name: StepPs
Sequence.documentation: 'StepPs.setMag.f' is the step size when turning from negative to positive direction.

Sequence.name: StepNg
Sequence.documentation: 'StepNg.setMag.f' is the step size when turning from positive to negative direction.

Sequence.name: Iec61850.DomainLN
Sequence.documentation: Abstract type, holding attributes common to all of all the domain logical nodes (corresponds to Common LN).

Sequence.name: NamPlt
Sequence.documentation: Name plate of the logical node.

Sequence.name: Beh
Sequence.documentation: 'DomainLN.Beh.stVal' is a read-only value, describing the behaviour of a domain logical node. It depends on the current operating mode of the logical node ('DomainLN.Mod.stVal'), and the current operating mode of the logical device that contains it ('LLN0.Mod.stVal'). Processing of the quality status (q) of the received data is the prerequisite for correct interpretation of 'DomainLN.Beh.stVal'. See statechart diagram 'DomainLN.behStateMachine'.

Sequence.name: Health
Sequence.documentation: 'Health.stVal' reflects the state of the logical node related hardware and software. More detailed information related to the source of the problem may be provided by specific attribute of the logical node.

Sequence.name: Blk
Sequence.documentation: If 'Blk.stVal=true', this function has been dynamically blocked.

Sequence.name: Mod
Sequence.documentation: 'DomainLN.Mod.ctlVal' is used by operator to initiate the change in the operating mode of the domain logical node. The resulting operating mode is 'DomainLN.Mod.stVal'. Processing of the quality status (q) of the received data is the prerequisite for correct interpretation of 'DomainLN.Mod.stVal'. See statechart diagram 'DomainLN.behStateMachine'.

Sequence.name: CmdBlk
Sequence.documentation: 'CmdBlk.ctlVal=true' initiates blocking of control sequences and action triggers of all controllable data objects in this function. The resulting status is 'CmdBlk.stVal'. NOTE This data object may be used only in case the logical node does not already contain BlkOpn/BlkCls available (i.e., logical nodes with controllable data objects, other than XCBR, XSWI, YPSH and KVLV).

Array.name: InRef
Array.documentation: 'InRef[i].setRef' is reference to the data object i bound to this input.

Array.name: BlkRef
Array.documentation: 'BlkRef[i].setRef' shows the receiving of dynamically blocking signal i.

Sequence.name: Iec61850.LLN0
Sequence.documentation: This logical node contains common information for logical devices (LDs).

Sequence.name: NamPlt
Sequence.documentation: Name plate of the logical device.

Sequence.name: Beh
Sequence.documentation: Behaviour of the LogicalNode. It can be either on, blocked, test, test/blocked, or off.

Sequence.name: Health
Sequence.documentation: 'Health.stVal' reflects the state of the logical device related hardware and software. It is derived from the worst (most critical) value of the health attribute of all the domain logical nodes contained in the logical device: 'Health.stVal' = max('DomainLN[i].Health.stVal').

Sequence.name: Blk
Sequence.documentation: If 'Blk.stVal=true', the function of the logical device has been dynamically blocked.

Sequence.name: Mod
Sequence.documentation: 'Mod.ctlVal' is used by operator to initiate the change in the operating mode of the logical device, which subsequently influences behaviour of the contained domain logical nodes ('DomainLN.Beh.stVal'). The resulting operating mode is 'DomainLN.Mod.stVal'. Processing of the quality status (q) of the received data is the prerequisite for correct interpretation of 'LLN0.Mod.stVal'. See statechart diagram 'DomainLN.behStateMachine'.

Sequence.name: CmdBlk
Sequence.documentation: 'CmdBlk.ctlVal=true' initiates blocking of control sequences and action triggers of all controllable data objects in the logical device. The resulting status is 'CmdBlk.stVal'.

Array.name: InRef
Array.documentation: 'InRef[i].setRef' is reference to the data object i bound to this input.

Array.name: BlkRef
Array.documentation: 'BlkRef[i].setRef' shows the receiving of dynamically blocking signal i.

Sequence.name: OpTmh
Sequence.documentation: 'OpTmh.stVal' is the operation time [h], of a physical device (???) since start of the operation.

Sequence.name: LocKey
Sequence.documentation: If 'LocKey.stVal=true', the operation of the complete logical device has been switched (from remote) to local. This changeover is always done locally with a physical key or toggle switch, which may have a set of contacts from which the position can be read.

Sequence.name: Loc
Sequence.documentation: If 'Loc.stVal=true', the control behaviour is allowed at this level. At bay level, "local" means operation from the bay unit and "remote" means operation from a station unit. At process level, "local" means direct operation on the process device (for example on a circuit breaker) and "remote" means operation from a bay unit. If in a logical device 'LLN0.Loc.stVal' is in contradiction to the any contained 'DomainLN.Loc', "local" is always dominant. (See also Annex B)

Sequence.name: LocSta
Sequence.documentation: 'LocSta.ctlVal=true' switches control authority to station level and disables control from remote. 'LocSta.ctlVal=false' does the opposite, i.e., it switches control authority from local to remote. The resulting status is 'LocSta.stVal'.

Sequence.name: Diag
Sequence.documentation: 'Diag.ctlVal=true' initiates running the diagnostics. The resulting status is 'Diag.stVal'.

Sequence.name: LEDRs
Sequence.documentation: 'LEDRs.ctlVal=true' initiates the resetting of all light emitting diodes. The resulting status is 'LEDRs.stVal'.

Sequence.name: GrRef
Sequence.documentation: 'GrRef.setRef' is the reference to a higher level logical device.

Sequence.name: MltLev
Sequence.documentation: If 'MltLev.setVal=true', authority control from multiple levels is allowed, otherwise no other control level is allowed (see Annex B).

Sequence.name: Iec61850.LPHD
Sequence.documentation: This logical node contains common information for physical devices (IEDs).

Sequence.name: PhyNam
Sequence.documentation: Physical device (IED) name plate.

Sequence.name: PhyHealth
Sequence.documentation: 'PhyHealth.stVal' reflects the state of the IED related hardware and software.

Sequence.name: OutOv
Sequence.documentation: If 'OutOv.stVal=true', an output communications buffer overflow occurred. Consequently, the annunciations important for the communication may be lost. A general interrogation is recommended or an integrity scan is started automatically.

Sequence.name: Proxy
Sequence.documentation: If 'Proxy.stVal=true', the IED is a proxy.

Sequence.name: InOv
Sequence.documentation: If 'InOv.stVal=true', an input communications buffer overflow occurred. Consequently, the annunciations important for the communication may be lost. A general interrogation is recommended or an integrity scan is started automatically.

Sequence.name: NumPwrUp
Sequence.documentation: 'NumPwrUp.stVal' is the number of power up operations of the IED since the last reset.

Sequence.name: WrmStr
Sequence.documentation: 'WrmStr.stVal' is the number of warm start operations of the IED since the last reset.

Sequence.name: WacTrg
Sequence.documentation: 'WacTrg.stVal' is the number of times the watchdog circuit has reset the IED since the counter reset.

Sequence.name: PwrUp
Sequence.documentation: If 'PwrUp.stVal=true', an IED power up has been detected.

Sequence.name: PwrDn
Sequence.documentation: If 'PwrDn.stVal=true', an IED power down has been detected.

Sequence.name: PwrSupAlm
Sequence.documentation: If 'PwrSupAlm.stVal=true', an alarm from the external power supply occured. It may be an external contact. It refers always to the local power supply of the IED, and not to the health (EEHealth) of the complete external supply system.

Sequence.name: Sim
Sequence.documentation: 'Sim.ctlVal=true' causes the IED to use simulated GOOSE or sampled measurand values instead of original ones since they are first received.

Sequence.name: RsStat
Sequence.documentation: 'RsStat.ctlVal=true' initiates the resetting of the IED security statistics.

Sequence.name: Iec61850.DERMeasurement
Sequence.documentation: This logical node is used for calculation of currents, voltages, powers and impedances in a three-phase system. The main use is for operative applications (61850 LogicalNode MMXU).

Sequence.name: ClcExp
Sequence.documentation: If 'ClcExp.stVal=true', the calculation period of a statistical logical node has expired.

Sequence.name: NamPlt
Sequence.documentation: Name plate of the logical node.

Sequence.name: TotW
Sequence.documentation: 'TotW.mag.f' is the total three-phase real power [W].

Sequence.name: Beh
Sequence.documentation: 'DomainLN.Beh.stVal' is a read-only value, describing the behaviour of a domain logical node. It depends on the current operating mode of the logical node ('DomainLN.Mod.stVal'), and the current operating mode of the logical device that contains it ('LLN0.Mod.stVal'). Processing of the quality status (q) of the received data is the prerequisite for correct interpretation of 'DomainLN.Beh.stVal'. See statechart diagram 'DomainLN.behStateMachine'.

Sequence.name: ClcStr
Sequence.documentation: 'ClcStr.ctlVal=true' enables the start calculation of statistical data, either immediately or at 'operTm' of the control model (if set). Resulting status is 'ClcStr.stVal'.

Sequence.name: TotVAr
Sequence.documentation: 'TotVAr.mag.f' is the total three-phase reactive power [VAr].

Sequence.name: ClcMth
Sequence.documentation: 'ClcMth.setVal' is the kind of statistical calculation, specifying how the data attributes that represent analogue values have been calculated. The calculation method shall be the same for all data objects of the logical node instance.

Sequence.name: Health
Sequence.documentation: 'Health.stVal' reflects the state of the logical node related hardware and software. More detailed information related to the source of the problem may be provided by specific attribute of the logical node.

Sequence.name: TotVA
Sequence.documentation: 'TotVA.mag.f' is the total three-phase apparent power [VA].

Sequence.name: Blk
Sequence.documentation: If 'Blk.stVal=true', this function has been dynamically blocked.

Sequence.name: ClcMod
Sequence.documentation: 'ClcMod.setVal' is the calculation mode.

Sequence.name: TotPF
Sequence.documentation: 'TotPF.mag.f' is the average three-phase power factor.

Sequence.name: ClcIntvTyp
Sequence.documentation: 'ClcIntvTyp.setVal' is the calculation interval type.

Sequence.name: Hz
Sequence.documentation: 'Hz.mag.f' is the frequency [Hz].

Sequence.name: Mod
Sequence.documentation: 'DomainLN.Mod.ctlVal' is used by operator to initiate the change in the operating mode of the domain logical node. The resulting operating mode is 'DomainLN.Mod.stVal'. Processing of the quality status (q) of the received data is the prerequisite for correct interpretation of 'DomainLN.Mod.stVal'. See statechart diagram 'DomainLN.behStateMachine'.

Sequence.name: ClcIntvPer
Sequence.documentation: 'ClcIntvPer.setVal' is the number of units to consider to calculate the calculation interval duration, in case 'ClcIntvTyp.setVal' other than 'external'.

Sequence.name: CmdBlk
Sequence.documentation: 'CmdBlk.ctlVal=true' initiates blocking of control sequences and action triggers of all controllable data objects in this function. The resulting status is 'CmdBlk.stVal'. NOTE This data object may be used only in case the logical node does not already contain BlkOpn/BlkCls available (i.e., logical nodes with controllable data objects, other than XCBR, XSWI, YPSH and KVLV).

Sequence.name: PPV

Array.name: InRef
Array.documentation: 'InRef[i].setRef' is reference to the data object i bound to this input.

Sequence.name: NumSubIntv
Sequence.documentation: 'NumSubIntv.setVal' is the number of sub-intervals contained in a calculation period interval duration.

Sequence.name: PhV
Sequence.documentation: 'PhV.[phsA,phsB,phsC].cVal.' hold phase to ground (line) voltage phasors [V]. For structure, see 'A'.

Sequence.name: A

Array.name: BlkRef
Array.documentation: 'BlkRef[i].setRef' shows the receiving of dynamically blocking signal i.

Sequence.name: ClcRfTyp
Sequence.documentation: 'ClcRfTyp.setVal' is the kind of refresh interval.

Sequence.name: ClcRfPer
Sequence.documentation: 'ClcRfPer.setVal' is the number of units to consider to calculate the refreshment interval duration in case 'ClcIntvTyp.setVal' is other than 'external'.

Sequence.name: W
Sequence.documentation: 'W.[phsA,phsB,phsC].cVal' hold the real powers [W] per phase. For structure, see 'A'.

Sequence.name: ClcSrc
Sequence.documentation: 'ClcSrc.setRef' is the object reference to the logical node whose analogue data attributes are used to calculate the values contained in this logical node instance.

Sequence.name: VAr
Sequence.documentation: 'VAr.[phsA,phsB,phsC].cVal' hold the reactive powers per phase [VAr]. For structure, see 'A'.

Sequence.name: ClcNxTmms
Sequence.documentation: 'ClcNxTmms.setVal' is the remaining time [ms] up to the end of the current calculation interval.

Sequence.name: VA
Sequence.documentation: 'VA.[phsA,phsB,phsC].cVal' hold the apparent powers per phase [VA]. For structure, see 'A'.

Sequence.name: InSyn
Sequence.documentation: 'InSyn.setRef' is the object reference to the source of the external synchronization signal for the calculation interval.

Sequence.name: PF
Sequence.documentation: 'PF.[phsA,phsB,phsC].cVal' hold the phase to ground power factor phasors. For structure, see 'A'.

Sequence.name: Z
Sequence.documentation: 'Z.[phsA,phsB,phsC].cVal' hold the impedances per phase. For structure, see 'A'.

Sequence.name: AvAPhs
Sequence.documentation: 'AvAPhs.mag.f' is the arithmetic average of the magnitude of current of the 3 phases: average(Ia,Ib,Ic).

Sequence.name: AvPPVPhs
Sequence.documentation: 'AvPPVPhs.mag.f' is the arithmetic average of the magnitude of phase to phase voltage of the 3 phases: average(PPVa, PPVb, PPVc).

Sequence.name: AvPhVPhs
Sequence.documentation: 'AvPhVPhs.mag.f' is the arithmetic average of the magnitude of phase to reference voltage of the 3 phases: average(PhVa, PhVb, PhVc).

Sequence.name: AvWPhs
Sequence.documentation: 'AvWPhs.mag.f' is the arithmetic average of the magnitude of active power of the 3 phases: average(Wa, Wb, Wc).

Sequence.name: AvVAPhs
Sequence.documentation: 'AvVAPhs.mag.f' is the arithmetic average of the magnitude of apparent power of the 3 phases: average(VAa, VAb, VAc).

Sequence.name: AvVArPhs
Sequence.documentation: 'AvVArPhs.mag.f' is the arithmetic average of the magnitude of rective power of the 3 phases: average(VAra, VArb, VArc).

Sequence.name: AvPFPhs
Sequence.documentation: 'AvPFPhs.mag.f' is the arithmetic average of the magnitude of power factor of the 3 phases.: average(PFa, PFb, PFc).

Sequence.name: AvZPhs
Sequence.documentation: 'AvZPhs.mag.f' is the arithmetic average of the magnitude of impedance of the 3 phases.: average(Za, Zb, Zc).

Sequence.name: MaxAPhs
Sequence.documentation: 'MaxAPhs.mag.f' is the maximum magnitude of current of the 3 phases: max(Ia,Ib,Ic).

Sequence.name: MaxPPVPhs
Sequence.documentation: 'MaxPPVPhs.mag.f' is the maximum magnitude of phase to phase voltage of the 3 phases: max(PPVa, PPVb, PPVc).

Sequence.name: MaxPhVPhs
Sequence.documentation: 'MaxPhVPhs.mag.f' is the maximum magnitude of phase to reference voltage of the 3 phases: max(PhVa, PhVb, PhVc).

Sequence.name: MaxWPhs
Sequence.documentation: 'MaxWPhs.mag.f' is the maximum magnitude of active power of the 3 phases: max(Wa, Wb, Wc).

Sequence.name: MaxVAPhs
Sequence.documentation: 'MaxVAPhs.mag.f' is the maximum magnitude of apparent power of the 3 phases: max(VAa, VAb, VAc).

Sequence.name: MaxVArPhs
Sequence.documentation: 'MaxVArPhs.mag.f' is the maximum magnitude of rective power of the 3 phases: max(VAra, VArb, VArc).

Sequence.name: MaxPFPhs
Sequence.documentation: 'MaxPFPhs.mag.f' is the maximum magnitude of power factor of the 3 phases.: max(PFa, PFb, PFc).

Sequence.name: MaxZPhs
Sequence.documentation: 'MaxZPhs.mag.f' is the maximum magnitude of impedance of the 3 phases.: max(Za, Zb, Zc).

Sequence.name: MinAPhs
Sequence.documentation: 'MinAPhs.mag.f' is the minimum magnitude of current of the 3 phases: min(Ia,Ib,Ic).

Sequence.name: MinPPVPhs
Sequence.documentation: 'MinPPVPhs.mag.f' is the minimum magnitude of phase to phase voltage of the 3 phases: min(PPVa, PPVb, PPVc).

Sequence.name: MinPhVPhs
Sequence.documentation: 'MinPhVPhs.mag.f' is the minimum magnitude of phase to reference voltage of the 3 phases: min(PhVa, PhVb, PhVc).

Sequence.name: MinWPhs
Sequence.documentation: 'MinWPhs.mag.f' is the minimum magnitude of active power of the 3 phases: min(Wa, Wb, Wc).

Sequence.name: MinVAPhs
Sequence.documentation: 'MinVAPhs.mag.f' is the minimum magnitude of apparent power of the 3 phases: min(VAa, VAb, VAc).

Sequence.name: MinVArPhs
Sequence.documentation: 'MinVArPhs.mag.f' is the minimum magnitude of rective power of the 3 phases: min(VAra, VArb, VArc).

Sequence.name: MinPFPhs
Sequence.documentation: 'MinPFPhs.mag.f' is the minimum magnitude of power factor of the 3 phases.: min(PFa, PFb, PFc).

Sequence.name: MinZPhs
Sequence.documentation: 'MinZPhs.mag.f' is the minimum magnitude of impedance of the 3 phases.: min(Za, Zb, Zc).

Sequence.name: ClcTotVA
Sequence.documentation: 'ClcTotVA.setVal' is the calculation method used for total apparent power 'TotVA'.

Sequence.name: PFSign
Sequence.documentation: 'PFSign.setVal' is the sign convention for power factor 'PF' (and reactive power 'VAr'.).
